snippet.authorDisplayName: Don Bruno Richard Martínez Olazábal Viavicencios
snippet.textDisplay:
So I just got a Surface Pro 7. I can say, without hesitation, Microsoft is FORKING itself worse than it did with its phone and Zune combined. The Pro X can go head to head with what will be the next iPad Pro and take it down in almost all categories except THE MOST IMPORTANT ONE, APPS‼️ Microsoft doesn’t even seem to care about its massive blunder or the fact that they will doom their Surface line.

It’s easier to see in the Pro 7. 3.5 weeks ago I was also given an iPad Pro 11 by Apple because my 3 10.5s were so defective it was the only option left. On said iPad Pro 11 (the first 11 I received 3 weeks ago was also effective. The pins in the USB-C port were misaligned. After a week it wouldn’t charge) I have only downloaded, maybe, 8%, of my iOS/iPadOS Apps. That is already TWICE as many Microsoft App Store that I have downloaded. Some of the Apps I’ve downloaded are proprietary Apps only on the creators inter webs site. Such as NordVPN, Dashlane, a couple of the 8 browsers I use, ioilo’s Phoenix, and about 4 more.

That is pathetic.

What do we discuss about new phones these days⁉️ Camera abilities and resolution and Screen size.

However, THE leading, underlying draw REMAINS KILLER APPS‼️

The Pro X may out class the next generation of the iPad Pro next September, but 10,000 Apps, most of which are Craft Projects, is going to keep the Pro X OUT of the game completely, despite the
Pro X’s, kind of overwhelming, superiority‼️

The ABSOLUTE SHORT SIGHTEDNESS of Microsoft continues to absolutely baffle me.

I’m running the top of the line IPad Pro side by side with my new Surface Pro 7. I actually really like, maybe love, my Pro 7, but the fucked up right out the gate‼️ The Surface Pro 7 HAS NO CELLULAR ANTENNAE BUILT IN‼️ Say what now⁉️ That is a HUGE FUBAR, and an ignorant one at that.

Don’t get me wrong, my Surface Pro 7 is just this side of a true laptop replacement. A full Windows 10 Pro 64 bit affords me such freedom, power, speed, capabilities, variety of programs (at least until they are all replaced by Apps, but the IPads won’t have the power) and True multi-tasking. I can run Photoshop on my Surface Pro 7 with no lag or detriment to anything else I’m running. The resolution is so much better. I Love having an actual keyboard that is so compact. Switching in and out of Tablet Mode makes the Pro 7 more familiar and if I’m not using any power Apps, so much faster. The built in kick stand is design genius.

The full Windows 10 Pro 64 bit make my Pro 7 a game changer. As I said, so close to an actual laptop replacement in such a compact package. Some may freak out at the lack of ports. Fear not, I found, what turned out to be, the Perfect USB-C Hub. It is Not by Microsoft, but by Tiergrade. It is nearly weightless, plugs into the USB-C port and offers 12 ports. Amount them HDMI, USB-A/A micro, USB 3.0, SD card slot and more.

The power and Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, resolution, so close to actual laptop replacement are great, and I love them all. However, without a robust, and I mean a minimum of 1/2 million Apps v. their current 10,000 it will be a business nitch player. The entire Surface line has a MAJOR Sisyphean battle for the Pro X to gain market share against an inferior next gen iPad Pro.

Much L♥️VE to you and the Whole of Team LTT‼️‼️‼️♥️♥️♥️✊🏼✊🏼✊🏼💻💻💻⚰️⚰️⚰️📲📲📲📲🥃🥃🥃
snippet.textOriginal:
So I just got a Surface Pro 7.  I can say, without hesitation, Microsoft is FORKING itself worse than it did with its phone and Zune combined.  The Pro X can go head to head with what will be the next iPad Pro and take it down in almost all categories except THE MOST IMPORTANT ONE, APPS‼️  Microsoft doesn’t even seem to care about its massive blunder or the fact that they will doom their Surface line.

It’s easier to see in the Pro 7.   3.5 weeks ago I was also given an iPad Pro 11 by Apple because my 3 10.5s were so defective it was the only option left.  On said iPad Pro 11 (the first 11 I received 3 weeks ago was also effective. The pins in the USB-C port were misaligned.  After a week it wouldn’t charge) I have only downloaded, maybe, 8%, of my iOS/iPadOS Apps.  That is already TWICE as many Microsoft App Store that I have downloaded.  Some of the Apps I’ve downloaded are proprietary Apps only on the creators inter webs site.  Such as NordVPN, Dashlane, a couple of the 8 browsers I use, ioilo’s Phoenix, and about 4 more. 

That is pathetic.  

What do we discuss about new phones these days⁉️  Camera abilities and resolution and Screen size.

However, THE leading, underlying draw REMAINS KILLER APPS‼️

The Pro X may out class the next generation of the iPad Pro next September, but 10,000 Apps, most of which are Craft Projects, is going to keep the Pro X OUT of the game completely, despite the 
Pro X’s, kind of overwhelming, superiority‼️ 

The ABSOLUTE SHORT SIGHTEDNESS of Microsoft continues to absolutely baffle me.

I’m running the top of the line IPad Pro side by side with my new Surface Pro 7.  I actually really like, maybe love, my Pro 7, but the fucked up right out the gate‼️  The Surface Pro 7 HAS NO CELLULAR ANTENNAE BUILT IN‼️  Say what now⁉️  That is a HUGE FUBAR, and an ignorant one at that.

Don’t get me wrong, my Surface Pro 7 is just this side of a true laptop replacement.  A full Windows 10 Pro 64 bit affords me such freedom, power, speed, capabilities, variety of programs (at least until they are all replaced by Apps, but the IPads won’t have the power) and True multi-tasking.  I can run Photoshop on my Surface Pro 7 with no lag or detriment to anything else I’m running.  The resolution is so much better.  I Love having an actual keyboard that is so compact.  Switching in and out of Tablet Mode makes the Pro 7 more familiar and if I’m not using any power Apps, so much faster.  The built in kick stand is design genius.

The full Windows 10 Pro 64 bit make my Pro 7 a game changer.  As I said, so close to an actual laptop replacement in such a compact package.  Some may freak out at the lack of ports.  Fear not, I found, what turned out to be, the Perfect USB-C Hub.  It is Not by Microsoft, but by Tiergrade.  It is nearly weightless, plugs into the USB-C port and offers 12 ports. Amount them HDMI, USB-A/A micro, USB 3.0, SD card slot and more.  

The power and Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, resolution, so close to actual laptop replacement are great, and I love them all.  However, without a robust, and I mean a minimum of 1/2 million Apps v. their current 10,000 it will be a business nitch player.  The entire Surface line has a MAJOR Sisyphean battle for the Pro X to gain market share against an inferior next gen iPad Pro.

Much L♥️VE to you and the Whole of Team LTT‼️‼️‼️♥️♥️♥️✊🏼✊🏼✊🏼💻💻💻⚰️⚰️⚰️📲📲📲📲🥃🥃🥃

snippet.textDisplay: Pauses video at Microsoft Store.. those apps still don't pay for Windows. It's shocking how Microsoft puts so little effort into their Windows Apps when the distribution model for those apps and Windows are there to encourage users to subscribe to paid services (office, OneDrive etc). snippet.textDisplay:
Simple answer: Because they want you to pay monthly/yearly TAX, instead of paying once for a product. Just like hollywood. Just like the music industry. Just like the games industry. None of them want to sell products anymore. They want you to pay tax instead. Why? With a product, the customer chooses to buy it or not. With a product, the customer is expected to have some rights, since he owns a property.

In other words: Selling products means the producer must prove MERIT, and the consumer can say "no". With taxes/services instead, the customer pays no matter what and has no rights, since he only paid for a temporary service, not a permanent product, so the producer can change the terms at a whim. And if your data also resides on their servers (FK the "cloud"), the consumer is basically just a slave, as the producer owns and controls everything, while you own and control absolutely nothing, and pay a monthly tax for the privilege of being alive.
snippet.textOriginal:

With a product, the customer is expected to have some rights, since he owns a property.

In other words: Selling products means the producer must prove MERIT, and the consumer can say "no". With taxes/services instead, the customer pays no matter what and has no rights, since he only paid for a temporary service, not a permanent product, so the producer can change the terms at a whim. snippet.textDisplay:
Sorry, but we aren't fooled by this explanation for why Windows 10 is "free".
Windows 10 is a root-kit, which sends everything you do (including microphone audio & key-logging) in telemetry packets encrypted using TLS v1.2, that you can't disable, back to Microsoft for monetization. (Install Wireshark if you want to see this happening for yourself in real-time)
Any company that has corporate data on a Windows 10 machine with an internet connection is an idiot that frankly deserves to have all their product designs and financial data stolen.
snippet.textOriginal:
Sorry, but we aren't fooled by this explanation for why Windows 10 is "free".
Windows 10 is a root-kit, which sends everything you do (including microphone audio & key-logging) in telemetry packets encrypted using TLS v1.2, that you can't disable, back to Microsoft for monetization. (Install Wireshark if you want to see this happening for yourself in real-time)
Any company that has corporate data on a Windows 10 machine with an internet connection is an idiot that frankly deserves to have all their product designs and financial data stolen.
